toxins.name: Plumericin
toxins.description:
in cats: This compound acts as a gastrointestinal irritant. Ingestion leads to clinical signs such as abdominal discomfort, diarrhea, dehydration, and electrolyte imbalance1.
4. Notes on
toxins.concentration_notes: The toxin is found in the bark, leaves, fruit, seeds, and sap of the plant. The severity of the toxicity is based on the exposure dose

symptoms.name: Abdominal discomfort (pain)
symptoms.onset: Not explicitly specified in the sources,
symptoms.notes:
This is a direct result of the compound plumericin acting as an irritant to the lining of the digestive tract1.
2. Diarrhea

symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.notes:
This is the primary sign of the plant's purgative (cathartic) effects1.
3. Dehydration

symptoms.name: Dehydration
symptoms.onset: Secondary effect, developing after sustained fluid loss from diarrhea.
symptoms.notes:
Veterinary treatment may involve fluid therapy to correct this1.
4. Electrolyte Imbalance

symptoms.name: Electrolyte imbalance
symptoms.notes: This occurs as a consequence of losing essential minerals through diarrhea and dehydration

treatments.name: Symptomatic Treatment
treatments.description: This is the primary course of action listed for Allamanda ingestion. It involves the administration of medications and supportive care specifically targeted to alleviate the clinical signs the cat is currently displaying, rather than using a specific antidote.
treatments.notes: The severity of the treatment depends entirely on the exposure dose. Veterinary intervention addresses the immediate abdominal discomfort and gastrointestinal distress caused by the plant's toxins

treatments.name: Fluid Therapy (Rehydration)
treatments.description: The administration of fluids (subcutaneous or intravenous) to restore hydration levels in the body.
treatments.notes: This is necessary to treat dehydration, a documented symptom of Allamanda toxicity resulting from the fluid loss associated with diarrhea

treatments.name: Management of Electrolyte Imbalance
treatments.description: Medical monitoring and replacement of essential minerals (electrolytes) to restore the body's natural balance.
treatments.notes: Allamanda ingestion can cause electrolyte imbalance due to gastrointestinal upset; this condition requires veterinary assessment to prevent systemic complications
